subject: Chris Wragge: Come Celebrate With Mom
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






May 11, 2007
Hi, 
      everyone, 
Russ Mitchell 
      was in Jamestown, Va., this morning for 
      Jamestown's 400th anniversary
so I was asked to man 
      the news desk on The Early Show. I am also 
      excited to be co-anchoring the Saturday Early 
      Show tomorrow morning with the lovely and talented Tracy 
      Smith. 

Right off, let me wish a Happy 
      Mother's Day to all the mothers 
      out there, including my own. This is Mom's weekend and tomorrow on the 
      Saturday Early Show, in keeping with the Mother's 
      Day theme, there'll be lots of fun for 
      everyone; be 
      sure to stop by if you're in New York. 
 
World famous chocolatier Jacques Torres will join 
      us on the plaza; he'll show us how to 
      make delicious -- and I'm 
      told, easy -- chocolate lollipops; we'll be handing them out to Early 
      Show fans.       
      
Our "Chef on a Shoestring" will 
      be cooking up an affordable 
      Mother's Day feast (she'll feed four for under $40!); CBS News 
      technology correspondent Daniel Seiberg will join us on 
      the plaza to show off the newest, coolest, travel gadgets; and if 
      you're thinking about buying a new outdoor grill, the folks from Consumer 
      Reports will show us which new models are best (and the best values, 
      too). And in the Second Cup Cafe, country music 
      duo Montgomery Gentry will be live in the studio, part of the kick-off for our coverage of 
      next week's 42nd annual Academy of Country Music awards, which 
      will be broadcast on CBS Tuesday night. Hannah Storm will 
      be in Las Vegas next week and she'll have guests like Reba McEntire, Vince 
      Gill and Carrie Underwood.  
Also on Monday, 
      we'll launch a series we're doing with the CBS Evening 
      News -- "Gotta Have It: The Hard Sell to 
      Kids." If you've ever wondered how nine-year-old girls know what’s 
      going to be in stores around the country before products hit the shelves, 
      this series explores how these savvy shoppers are formed. 
      
I hope you'll join Tracy and me tomorrow 
      morning from 7 a.m. to 9 
      a.m. The weather is expected to be near perfect -- I checked with Ira Joe! -- 
      and there's no better 
      way to start your weekend than with 
      our crew on the plaza! And chocolate lollipops for everyone! 
      

Thanks and see you on 
      TV!
 
      
Chris WraggeEarlyShow@cbs.com
